channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: CFSum: A Coarse-to-Fine Contribution Network for Multimodal Summarization
item.description: Therefore, we propose a novel Coarse-to-Fine contribution network for multimodal Summarization (CFSum) to consider different contributions of images for summarization.

item.title: Learning to Solve Tasks with Exploring Prior Behaviours
item.description: Our method can endow agents with the ability to explore and acquire the required prior behaviours and then connect to the task-specific behaviours in the demonstration to solve sparse-reward tasks without requiring additional demonstration of the prior behaviours.

item.title: LEO: Learning Efficient Orderings for Multiobjective Binary Decision Diagrams
item.description: We show how the configuration space can be efficiently explored using black-box optimization, circumventing the curse of dimensionality (in the number of variables and objectives), and finding good orderings that reduce the PF enumeration time.

item.title: Through the Fairness Lens: Experimental Analysis and Evaluation of Entity Matching
item.description: Entity matching (EM) is a challenging problem studied by different communities for over half a century.

item.title: Focused Transformer: Contrastive Training for Context Scaling
item.description: This novel approach enhances the structure of the (key, value) space, enabling an extension of the context length.

item.title: ALPCAH: Sample-wise Heteroscedastic PCA with Tail Singular Value Regularization
item.description: Other methods such as Weighted PCA (WPCA) assume the noise variances are known, which may be difficult to know in practice.

item.title: Your spouse needs professional help: Determining the Contextual Appropriateness of Messages through Modeling Social Relationships
item.description: We introduce a new dataset of contextually-situated judgments of appropriateness and show that large language models can readily incorporate relationship information to accurately identify appropriateness in a given context.

item.title: Distilling Large Vision-Language Model with Out-of-Distribution Generalizability
item.description: Model distillation, the process of creating smaller, faster models that maintain the performance of larger models, is a promising direction towards the solution.

item.title: RecallM: An Architecture for Temporal Context Understanding and Question Answering
item.description: The ideal long-term memory mechanism for Large Language Model (LLM) based chatbots, would lay the foundation for continual learning, complex reasoning and allow sequential and temporal dependencies to be learnt.

item.title: Proto-CLIP: Vision-Language Prototypical Network for Few-Shot Learning
item.description: The two encoders are used to compute prototypes of image classes for classification.

item.title: Knowledge Graph Self-Supervised Rationalization for Recommendation
item.description: By masking important knowledge with high rational scores, KGRec is trained to rebuild and highlight useful knowledge connections that serve as rationales.

item.title: Learning Disentangled Representations in Signed Directed Graphs without Social Assumptions
item.description: In this paper, we propose DINES, a novel method for learning disentangled node representations in signed directed graphs without social assumptions.

item.title: Efficient Semiring-Weighted Earley Parsing
item.description: This paper provides a reference description, in the form of a deduction system, of Earley's (1970) context-free parsing algorithm with various speed-ups.

item.title: Censored Sampling of Diffusion Models Using 3 Minutes of Human Feedback
item.description: Sometimes, however, a pre-trained diffusion model exhibits partial misalignment in the sense that the model can generate good images, but it sometimes outputs undesirable images.

item.title: Learning Curves for Heterogeneous Feature-Subsampled Ridge Ensembles
item.description: We study an ensemble of linear predictors, each fit using ridge regression on a subset of the available features.

item.title: BLEURT Has Universal Translations: An Analysis of Automatic Metrics by Minimum Risk Training
item.description: In this study, we systematically analyze and compare various mainstream and cutting-edge automatic metrics from the perspective of their guidance for training machine translation systems.

item.title: ContainerGym: A Real-World Reinforcement Learning Benchmark for Resource Allocation
item.description: It is sufficiently versatile to evaluate reinforcement learning algorithms on any real-world problem that fits our resource allocation framework.

item.title: KoRC: Knowledge oriented Reading Comprehension Benchmark for Deep Text Understanding
item.description: However, these benchmarks have encountered two major limitations.

item.title: DeepOnto: A Python Package for Ontology Engineering with Deep Learning
item.description: Applying deep learning techniques, particularly language models (LMs), in ontology engineering has raised widespread attention.

item.title: Transfer Learning for the Efficient Detection of COVID-19 from Smartphone Audio Data
item.description: The efficacy of this solution mainly depends on the performances of AI algorithms applied to the collected data and their possible implementation directly on the users' mobile devices.

item.title: T-MARS: Improving Visual Representations by Circumventing Text Feature Learning
item.description: However, naively removing all such data could also be wasteful, as it throws away images that contain visual features (in addition to overlapping text).

item.title: The Role of Subgroup Separability in Group-Fair Medical Image Classification
item.description: We investigate performance disparities in deep classifiers.

item.title: Semi-supervised Domain Adaptive Medical Image Segmentation through Consistency Regularized Disentangled Contrastive Learning
item.description: In this work, we investigate relatively less explored semi-supervised domain adaptation (SSDA) for medical image segmentation, where access to a few labeled target samples can improve the adaptation performance substantially.

item.title: A Privacy-Preserving Walk in the Latent Space of Generative Models for Medical Applications
item.description: Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) have demonstrated their ability to generate synthetic samples that match a target distribution.

item.title: Efficient Domain Adaptation of Sentence Embeddings using Adapters
item.description: Instead, we only train a small number of additional parameters while keeping the weights of the underlying sentence embedding model fixed.

item.title: BaBE: Enhancing Fairness via Estimation of Latent Explaining Variables
item.description: We consider the problem of unfair discrimination between two groups and propose a pre-processing method to achieve fairness.

item.title: Benchmarking Test-Time Adaptation against Distribution Shifts in Image Classification
item.description: To implement this benchmark, we have developed a unified framework in PyTorch, which allows for consistent evaluation and comparison of the TTA methods across the different datasets and network architectures.

item.title: Fourier-Net+: Leveraging Band-Limited Representation for Efficient 3D Medical Image Registration
item.description: Instead of directly predicting a full-resolution displacement field, our Fourier-Net learns a low-dimensional representation of the displacement field in the band-limited Fourier domain which our model-driven decoder converts to a full-resolution displacement field in the spatial domain.

item.title: Advancing Zero-Shot Digital Human Quality Assessment through Text-Prompted Evaluation
item.description: To address this gap, we propose SJTU-H3D, a subjective quality assessment database specifically designed for full-body digital humans.

item.title: Improving Retrieval-Augmented Large Language Models via Data Importance Learning
item.description: There are exponentially many terms in the multilinear extension, and one key contribution of this paper is a polynomial time algorithm that computes exactly, given a retrieval-augmented model with an additive utility function and a validation set, the data importance of data points in the retrieval corpus using the multilinear extension of the model's utility function.

item.title: Towards accurate instance segmentation in large-scale LiDAR point clouds
item.description: Panoptic segmentation is the combination of semantic and instance segmentation: assign the points in a 3D point cloud to semantic categories and partition them into distinct object instances.

item.title: Generalizing Backpropagation for Gradient-Based Interpretability
item.description: Many popular feature-attribution methods for interpreting deep neural networks rely on computing the gradients of a model's output with respect to its inputs.

item.title: A Survey on Evaluation of Large Language Models
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) are gaining increasing popularity in both academia and industry, owing to their unprecedented performance in various applications.

item.title: MDViT: Multi-domain Vision Transformer for Small Medical Image Segmentation Datasets
item.description: Naivly combining datasets from different domains can result in negative knowledge transfer (NKT), i. e., a decrease in model performance on some domains with non-negligible inter-domain heterogeneity.

item.title: LongNet: Scaling Transformers to 1,000,000,000 Tokens
item.description: Scaling sequence length has become a critical demand in the era of large language models.

item.title: A Comparison of Machine Learning Methods for Data with High-Cardinality Categorical Variables
item.description: High-cardinality categorical variables are variables for which the number of different levels is large relative to the sample size of a data set, or in other words, there are few data points per level.

item.title: EHRSHOT: An EHR Benchmark for Few-Shot Evaluation of Foundation Models
item.description: The success of foundation models creates new challenges for healthcare ML by requiring access to shared pretrained models to validate performance benefits.

item.title: SpaceNLI: Evaluating the Consistency of Predicting Inferences in Space
item.description: While many natural language inference (NLI) datasets target certain semantic phenomena, e. g., negation, tense & aspect, monotonicity, and presupposition, to the best of our knowledge, there is no NLI dataset that involves diverse types of spatial expressions and reasoning.

item.title: Won't Get Fooled Again: Answering Questions with False Premises
item.description: In this paper, we find that the PLMs already possess the knowledge required to rebut such questions, and the key is how to activate the knowledge.

item.title: Human Inspired Progressive Alignment and Comparative Learning for Grounded Word Acquisition
item.description: Human language acquisition is an efficient, supervised, and continual process.

item.title: Remote Sensing Image Change Detection with Graph Interaction
item.description: More specifically, by leveraging the concept of non-local operations and mapping the features obtained from the backbone network to the graph structure space, we propose a unified self-focus mechanism for bitemporal images. This approach enhances the information coupling between the two temporal images while effectively suppressing task-irrelevant interference, Based on a streamlined backbone architecture, namely ResNet18, our model demonstrates superior performance compared to other state-of-the-art methods (SOTA) on the GZ CD dataset.

item.title: First-Explore, then Exploit: Meta-Learning Intelligent Exploration
item.description: We argue a core barrier prohibiting many RL approaches from learning intelligent exploration is that the methods attempt to explore and exploit simultaneously, which harms both exploration and exploitation as the goals often conflict.

item.title: Safety Shielding under Delayed Observation
item.description: We propose synthesis algorithms to compute \emph{delay-resilient shields} that guarantee safety under worst-case assumptions on the delays of the input signals.

item.title: MAE-DFER: Efficient Masked Autoencoder for Self-supervised Dynamic Facial Expression Recognition
item.description: Inspired by recent unprecedented success of masked autoencoders (e. g., VideoMAE), this paper proposes MAE-DFER, a novel self-supervised method which leverages large-scale self-supervised pre-training on abundant unlabeled data to advance the development of DFER.

item.title: Modelling Spontaneous Firing Activity of the Motor Cortex in a Spiking Neural Network with Random and Local Connectivity
item.description: A local connectivity scheme was implemented to introduce more physiological plausibility to the cortex model, and the effect on the rates, distributions and irregularity of neuronal firing was compared to the original random connectivity method and experimental data.

item.title: Multilingual Controllable Transformer-Based Lexical Simplification
item.description: Moreover, further evaluation of our approach on the part of the recent TSAR-2022 multilingual LS shared-task dataset shows that our model performs competitively when compared with the participating systems for English LS and even outperforms the GPT-3 model on several metrics.

item.title: Causal Discovery with Language Models as Imperfect Experts
item.description: Understanding the causal relationships that underlie a system is a fundamental prerequisite to accurate decision-making.

item.title: Beyond Known Reality: Exploiting Counterfactual Explanations for Medical Research
item.description: The results demonstrate the promising potential of counterfactual explanations to enhance trust and acceptance of AI-driven methods in clinical settings.

item.title: Deductive Additivity for Planning of Natural Language Proofs
item.description: Specifically, we evaluate whether embedding spaces exhibit a property we call deductive additivity: the sum of premise statement embeddings should be close to embeddings of conclusions based on those premises.

item.title: Emoji Prediction using Transformer Models
item.description: We fine-tuned BERT on a large corpus of text containing both text and emojis to predict the most appropriate emoji for a given text.
